text: The is a Japanese river which flows through Tokyo. It crosses the north part of Tokyo and drains into Tokyo Bay.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Sumida- gawa)" in Japan encyclopedia, p. 912. ==Sumida bridges== The Sumida runs through Tokyo for 27 kilometers. There are 26 bridges across the river, including * Ryōgoku Bridge (Ryōgoku-bashi)National Archives of Japan (NAJ), Ryogoku bridge (1875) ; retrieved 2012-6-4. * Nihon bridge (Nihon-bashi) * Eitai BridgeTitsingh, Isaac. (1834).
